Subjective: Sore throat x 3 days, unbearable, painful swallowing. Fever this morning (after paracetamol). Started with cough last week, now resolved. No shortness of breath, no runny nose/cold symptoms. Can swallow/drink but painful. No one around sick. Impact on daily life: Painful swallowing affecting comfort, general malaise. No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Request: Worried about abscess, wants antibiotics.
Objective: Temp: 38.3 C (after 2 paracetamol). Saturation: 98%. Ears: Left: air-filled eardrum, no inflammation. Right: slight redness in ear canal, otherwise normal, no inflammation. Neck: Small submandibular lymph nodes, non-pathological. Throat: Median uvula. Slightly red pharyngeal arch. Slightly enlarged tonsils, not kissing. Little slough bilateral. No abscess. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no adventitious sounds.
Assessment: Pharyngitis, likely viral etiology. Fever. No signs of peritonsillar abscess. No signs of bacterial infection requiring antibiotics.
Plan: Explanation: Viral pharyngitis, antibiotics not effective. Symptoms may resolve half a day sooner with antibiotics, but no significant change in course.
Safety Net: Return if much sicker, shortness of breath, or unable to swallow properly.
